intro: Loxotrema cuspidata, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It is native to regions of North America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Loxotrema cuspidata is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
